Memberships
If you are looking to shoot in our state-of-the-art indoor range on a regular basis, we recommend becoming a member. Our memberships provide members with the best rental prices, gun transfers, training classes, store discounts, and guest fees/passes for the best price in the area.
Membership pricing is per person, per year.  Family membership pricing is also available (must be able to provide valid Driver's License with same address).

Classes & Events
In addition to providing basic gun safety instruction with every purchase, Volusia Top Gun offers firearms-related classes taught by trained professionals with vast experience and knowledge. Whether you are a frequent shooter or just starting out, we provide a variety of classes for every experience level that are fun, exciting, and challenging.

FL CCW
Course
$75 Per Person
Includes classroom instruction and range time. & 50% off 1 hour of range time, or $20 off a private lesson.
Firearm and ammo will be provided.
Saturday, Sunday & Thursday morning classes all start at 10am. Friday evening classes start at 5pm and typically run 4 hours.
Please arrive 20 minutes early.
*Reservation required to hold a spot for the CCW course. Limited seating available.
*You can call the store to reserve a spot @ 386-363-3534 or sign up online by clicking the link below.
>CONCEALED CLASS SIGN-UP<
Class dates Below
Aug 17th @ 10am
Aug 21st @ 10am
Aug 23rd @ 10am
Aug 31st @ 10am
Sept 6th @ 10am
Sept 14th @ 10am
Sept 18th @ 10am
Sept 20th @ 10am
Sept 26th @ 5pm
Sept 28th @ 10am
Private Lessons
$100 individual
$150 for 2 shooters
If you are brand new to shooting, or just getting back into the game, it is recommended that you participate in a private lesson. Private lessons are approximately 1.5 hours of one-on-one with our range staff. If you would like to utilize your personal firearm, please ensure your firearm is unloaded prior to the lesson and that your ammunition is the correct type to use (please see
Range Rules and Regulations
).
Targets and eye/ear protection are provided with the lesson if you do not have your own. Firearm rentals and ammunition are available but are not included in the price and will be an additional fee. Lessons are offered seven days a week (unless there is an event taking place). Lessons need to be booked in advance and require a $25 deposit (non-refundable) to secure your slot. The deposit is included with the price of the lesson and the remaining balance is paid at the time of your lesson. To reserve a time, please contact an associate at the range counter and we will be happy to make the appointment for you.
**Please note that if you are 15 minutes late, your lesson will be canceled.**
Firearm Safety Rules:
Treat every firearm as if it were loaded
Keep your finger off the trigger until ready to fire.
Be sure of your target and what is next to and beyond it.
Never point a firearm at anything you are not willing to injure, damage and/or destroy.
Lessons include:
Understanding the basic firearms safety rules
Eye dominance
Nomenclature/parts
Strong hand/weak hand
Stance
Grip
Sight alignment/sight picture
Loading/unloading
Trigger control
Private lessons will begin in a classroom setting that does not include live fire on the shooting range. Once your Range Safety Officer feels that you are proficient and that you understand what you learned in the classroom setting, your lesson will move to a “hands-on” live fire approach in the shooting range. They will assist you with applying the fundamentals recently acquired in the classroom and even further your understanding of the fundamentals during the live fire session.
Volusia Top Gun
Bowl and Bang League
Last Sunday of every month
Volusia Top Gun Monthly Bowling Pin Shoot
The Bowl and Bang League will be conducted on the last Sunday of every month.
Each match winner will receive a $100 gift card to Volusia Top Gun and an exclusive “Volusia Top Gun Bowl and Bang Winner” patch.
• $25 buy-in. Matches start at approximately 5:30 PM (after the store/range closes). Be here by 5:15pm as the front doors will be  locked due to the store closing at 5pm.
• No refunds after event. No show = no refunds due to the bracket being made just prior to the start of the event based on sign-ups.
• Maximum of 32 shooters. Single elimination format.
• Two bays will run simultaneously until the final 4 shooters.
o A third bay (“Loser’s Lane”) will be available for eliminated shooters to continue shooting for fun. Shoot against your buddy or call someone out, doesn’t matter, just shoot because you can!
• A winner may not win again for one year to ensure fair opportunity for all participants.
o If a past winner still wishes to shoot in future events, their opponent receives a bye to the next round.
o The past winners will proceed to the third bay after their first-round match.
• When not shooting, participants must wait in the lounge until called.
• Any production handgun is allowed with minor modifications. Bolt-on comps/ported guns are permitted. Please do not bring full on race guns.
• Firearms must arrive unloaded and stored in a case or bag. Open carry is prohibited.
• Firearms may only be unbagged at the bench when instructed by staff.
• Magazines are limited to 7 rounds. No limit on the number of magazines.
o Reloads may be done from a belt pouch or the bench.
• Starting position: loaded and low ready, with firearm touching the bench. RSO will confirm both shooters are ready and then give the command/stimulus to start.
• All WHITE pins will be knocked off first, BEFORE the GOLD pin is shot. First one to have the GOLD pin knocked off the bench wins.
• Volusia Top Gun staff that are participants will run from their holsters.
• When the stage is complete, shooters will unload and show the firearm is clear to the RSO. The RSO will acknowledge the firearm is clear and instruct you to put your firearm back into your bag/case.
• Do NOT approach the bench while staff is downrange. Violators will be ejected without a refund.
• All standard range rules and waivers apply.
o Any shot striking the ceiling (between shooter and top of backstop) or the floor (between shooter and base of the stand) is subject to a $100 carrier fee per shot.
o Ricochets off pins/stands are not considered negligent.
Handgun 1
Shooting Course
$150 per Person
Want to see how deep the rabbit hole goes? Starting to get more curious about training and learn what you’re capable of?
Let us help you put in work with your firearm.
Our Handgun 1 course picks up from our individual private lessons and dives into fine tuning fundamentals, while also working on drawing from an outside the waist holster (open carry style). With a close student/instructor ratio, we help you further your knowledge, dig deeper into the how and why, add to your skillset, and staged in a safe and controlled environment. This 4 hour, beginner/intermediate level course goes into further understanding technique and help you understand what works for you. All while having fun and being pushed to the limit and knowing what you need to strive for to get yourself to the next level and gain more confidence in your firearm handling. This is a dynamic shooting course!! You WILL shoot hundreds of rounds in just a few hours. We will push your limits. There’s no need for sunblock, you don’t have to worry about rain, or care what the weather is outside as the course is conducted in our facility. You can concentrate on learning!
This course is recommended (but not required) prior to taking the Carry 1 course.
Requirements (student to provide);
-Eye/ear protection
-Firearm (mid-size/compact to full/duty-size, firearms with large capacity are recommended)
– Magazines (minimum of 3). The more mags you have and can fill, the more time you’ll spend shooting instead of loading.
-Ammunition (at least 400 rounds)
-Snap Caps/dummy rounds for caliber you are using (recommended but not required)
-Holster (dominant side, belt mounted, outside the waistband; no Serpa style, no small of the back or shoulder holster carry)
-Spare magazine holder/pouch (recommended but not required)
-Basic firearm knowledge/proficiency (firearm handling, loading, unloading)
-Must have fired at least 250rds through the firearm to be used and familiar with it’s function
-AN OPEN MIND AND WILLINGNESS TO LEARN!
**Payment of $150 per person due at sign up to reserve your slot. Minimum 2 students, if the minimum is not met, the class will be postponed. Maximum of 4 students for this class. Must be fully prepared day of class. Please inquire about requirements or any questions prior to the class with Ray (ray@volusiatopgun.com).
Ray (General Manager) travels to take multiple classes from advanced instructors yearly to continue his education and further his progress. He constantly trains monthly and pushes to his personal limits. He takes the knowledge he gains and acquires and passes it on to help you develop a solid foundation to build from.
Carry 1
So you finally got your Florida Concealed Weapon License and you have your firearm you decided to carry. You learned how to use it and put some rounds down range with it, now what?
What’s the next step?
We help you get proficient in learning to draw your firearm from concealment in a dynamic environment.
Our Intro to Concealed Carry/Carry 1 course goes over the fundamentals of drawing from concealment with a close student/instructor ratio. Providing the building blocks for you to develop the skills and fundamentals to be proficient and understand technique, while being in a safe and controlled environment. This is a dynamic 4 hour, beginner/intermediate level course and is not a standing around static, target shooting class. You can do that on the range on your own. We make you work the firearm from concealment, establishing fundamentals, proper indexing with explaining how and why, and put rounds on target with added stress all while gaining confidence. With the discussion of type of firearm, ccw type of holster, pros/cons, mindset and shooting under stress. There’s no need for sunblock, you don’t have to worry about rain, or care what the weather is outside as the course is conducted in our facility. You can concentrate on learning!
Handgun 1 is highly recommended (but not required) prior to taking the Carry 1 course.
Requirements (student to provide);
-Eye/ear protection
-Firearm
-Magazines (minimum of 2, or at least 3 if capacity less than 10rds or speed loader for revolver). The more mags you can fill, the more time you’ll spend shooting instead of loading.
-Ammunition (at least 350 rounds)
-Snap Caps/dummy rounds for caliber you are using (recommended but not required)
-Holster (dominant side, belt mounted, inside or outside the waistband; no Serpa style, no pocket holster or pocket clip style unless it is with a trigger guard cover, no small of the back or shoulder holster carry)
-Spare magazine holder (if running spare magazine, recommended but not required)
-Basic firearm knowledge/proficiency (firearm handling, loading, unloading)
-Must have fired at least 250rds through firearm
-AN OPEN MIND AND WILLINGNESS TO LEARN!
Be aware, we will do a lot of shooting during this class. More than you probably would in a typical range session while holstering your firearm into your concealment holster. The firearm will get hot due to the faster pace and volume of shooting during strings of fire.
**Payment of $150 per person due at sign up to reserve your slot. Minimum 2 students, if the minimum is not met, the class will be postponed. Maximum of 4 students for this class. Must be fully prepared day of class. Please inquire about requirements or any questions prior to the class with Ray (ray@volusiatopgun.com).
Ray (General Manager) travels to take multiple classes from advanced instructors yearly to continue his education and further his progress. He constantly trains monthly and pushes to his personal limits. He takes the knowledge he gains and acquires and passes it on to help you develop a solid foundation to build from.
Events
Wine Down
Wednesday
Every Wednesday is ladies’ day!
Wine down after work by unloading some rounds at the range and then joining us for a drink at the Double Barrel Grill.
Ladies receive half off range fees and firearm rentals at the range, and a buy one get one free domestic draft beer or house wine at Double Barrel Grill when you show your range receipt to your server. This offer is valid only on day of range visit. Your receipt can also be used for a soda of your choice.
Thank You Thursdays!!
Here at Volusia Top  Gun we appreciate everything that our first responders and military have done for us and our country.
To say thanks, ANY first responder (police, fire, evac) and Military Personal (Active, Retired, Discharged) can come use the range for 1/2 price.
ACTIVE LAW ENFORCEMENT
are half off range fees every day (Law Enforcement Officer as defined in FL Statute 943.10)

Private Lessons
$100 individual
$150 for 2 shooters
If you are brand new to shooting, or just getting back into the game, it is recommended that you participate in a private lesson. Private lessons are approximately 1.5 hours of one-on-one with our range staff. If you would like to utilize your personal firearm, please ensure your firearm is unloaded prior to the lesson and that your ammunition is the correct type to use (please see
Range Rules and Regulations
).
Targets and eye/ear protection are provided with the lesson if you do not have your own. Firearm rentals and ammunition are available but are not included in the price and will be an additional fee. Lessons are offered seven days a week (unless there is an event taking place). Lessons need to be booked in advance and require a $25 deposit (non-refundable) to secure your slot. The deposit is included with the price of the lesson and the remaining balance is paid at the time of your lesson. To reserve a time, please contact an associate at the range counter and we will be happy to make the appointment for you.
**Please note that if you are 15 minutes late, your lesson will be canceled.**
Firearm Safety Rules:
Treat every firearm as if it were loaded
Keep your finger off the trigger until ready to fire.
Be sure of your target and what is next to and beyond it.
Never point a firearm at anything you are not willing to injure, damage and/or destroy.
Lessons include:
Understanding the basic firearms safety rules
Eye dominance
Nomenclature/parts
Strong hand/weak hand
Stance
Grip
Sight alignment/sight picture
Loading/unloading
Trigger control
Private lessons will begin in a classroom setting that does not include live fire on the shooting range. Once your Range Safety Officer feels that you are proficient and that you understand what you learned in the classroom setting, your lesson will move to a “hands-on” live fire approach in the shooting range. They will assist you with applying the fundamentals recently acquired in the classroom and even further your understanding of the fundamentals during the live fire session.
Volusia Top Gun
Bowl and Bang League
Last Sunday of every month
Volusia Top Gun Monthly Bowling Pin Shoot
The Bowl and Bang League will be conducted on the last Sunday of every month.
Each match winner will receive a $100 gift card to Volusia Top Gun and an exclusive “Volusia Top Gun Bowl and Bang Winner” patch.
• $25 buy-in. Matches start at approximately 5:30 PM (after the store/range closes). Be here by 5:15pm as the front doors will be  locked due to the store closing at 5pm.
• No refunds after event. No show = no refunds due to the bracket being made just prior to the start of the event based on sign-ups.
• Maximum of 32 shooters. Single elimination format.
• Two bays will run simultaneously until the final 4 shooters.
o A third bay (“Loser’s Lane”) will be available for eliminated shooters to continue shooting for fun. Shoot against your buddy or call someone out, doesn’t matter, just shoot because you can!
• A winner may not win again for one year to ensure fair opportunity for all participants.
o If a past winner still wishes to shoot in future events, their opponent receives a bye to the next round.
o The past winners will proceed to the third bay after their first-round match.
• When not shooting, participants must wait in the lounge until called.
• Any production handgun is allowed with minor modifications. Bolt-on comps/ported guns are permitted. Please do not bring full on race guns.
• Firearms must arrive unloaded and stored in a case or bag. Open carry is prohibited.
• Firearms may only be unbagged at the bench when instructed by staff.
• Magazines are limited to 7 rounds. No limit on the number of magazines.
o Reloads may be done from a belt pouch or the bench.
• Starting position: loaded and low ready, with firearm touching the bench. RSO will confirm both shooters are ready and then give the command/stimulus to start.
• All WHITE pins will be knocked off first, BEFORE the GOLD pin is shot. First one to have the GOLD pin knocked off the bench wins.
• Volusia Top Gun staff that are participants will run from their holsters.
• When the stage is complete, shooters will unload and show the firearm is clear to the RSO. The RSO will acknowledge the firearm is clear and instruct you to put your firearm back into your bag/case.
• Do NOT approach the bench while staff is downrange. Violators will be ejected without a refund.
• All standard range rules and waivers apply.
o Any shot striking the ceiling (between shooter and top of backstop) or the floor (between shooter and base of the stand) is subject to a $100 carrier fee per shot.
o Ricochets off pins/stands are not considered negligent.
Handgun 1
Shooting Course
$150 per Person
Want to see how deep the rabbit hole goes? Starting to get more curious about training and learn what you’re capable of?
Let us help you put in work with your firearm.
Our Handgun 1 course picks up from our individual private lessons and dives into fine tuning fundamentals, while also working on drawing from an outside the waist holster (open carry style). With a close student/instructor ratio, we help you further your knowledge, dig deeper into the how and why, add to your skillset, and staged in a safe and controlled environment. This 4 hour, beginner/intermediate level course goes into further understanding technique and help you understand what works for you. All while having fun and being pushed to the limit and knowing what you need to strive for to get yourself to the next level and gain more confidence in your firearm handling. This is a dynamic shooting course!! You WILL shoot hundreds of rounds in just a few hours. We will push your limits. There’s no need for sunblock, you don’t have to worry about rain, or care what the weather is outside as the course is conducted in our facility. You can concentrate on learning!
This course is recommended (but not required) prior to taking the Carry 1 course.
Requirements (student to provide);
-Eye/ear protection
-Firearm (mid-size/compact to full/duty-size, firearms with large capacity are recommended)
– Magazines (minimum of 3). The more mags you have and can fill, the more time you’ll spend shooting instead of loading.
-Ammunition (at least 400 rounds)
-Snap Caps/dummy rounds for caliber you are using (recommended but not required)
-Holster (dominant side, belt mounted, outside the waistband; no Serpa style, no small of the back or shoulder holster carry)
-Spare magazine holder/pouch (recommended but not required)
-Basic firearm knowledge/proficiency (firearm handling, loading, unloading)
-Must have fired at least 250rds through the firearm to be used and familiar with it’s function
-AN OPEN MIND AND WILLINGNESS TO LEARN!
**Payment of $150 per person due at sign up to reserve your slot. Minimum 2 students, if the minimum is not met, the class will be postponed. Maximum of 4 students for this class. Must be fully prepared day of class. Please inquire about requirements or any questions prior to the class with Ray (ray@volusiatopgun.com).
Ray (General Manager) travels to take multiple classes from advanced instructors yearly to continue his education and further his progress. He constantly trains monthly and pushes to his personal limits. He takes the knowledge he gains and acquires and passes it on to help you develop a solid foundation to build from.
Carry 1
So you finally got your Florida Concealed Weapon License and you have your firearm you decided to carry. You learned how to use it and put some rounds down range with it, now what?
What’s the next step?
We help you get proficient in learning to draw your firearm from concealment in a dynamic environment.
Our Intro to Concealed Carry/Carry 1 course goes over the fundamentals of drawing from concealment with a close student/instructor ratio. Providing the building blocks for you to develop the skills and fundamentals to be proficient and understand technique, while being in a safe and controlled environment. This is a dynamic 4 hour, beginner/intermediate level course and is not a standing around static, target shooting class. You can do that on the range on your own. We make you work the firearm from concealment, establishing fundamentals, proper indexing with explaining how and why, and put rounds on target with added stress all while gaining confidence. With the discussion of type of firearm, ccw type of holster, pros/cons, mindset and shooting under stress. There’s no need for sunblock, you don’t have to worry about rain, or care what the weather is outside as the course is conducted in our facility. You can concentrate on learning!
Handgun 1 is highly recommended (but not required) prior to taking the Carry 1 course.
Requirements (student to provide);
-Eye/ear protection
-Firearm
-Magazines (minimum of 2, or at least 3 if capacity less than 10rds or speed loader for revolver). The more mags you can fill, the more time you’ll spend shooting instead of loading.
-Ammunition (at least 350 rounds)
-Snap Caps/dummy rounds for caliber you are using (recommended but not required)
-Holster (dominant side, belt mounted, inside or outside the waistband; no Serpa style, no pocket holster or pocket clip style unless it is with a trigger guard cover, no small of the back or shoulder holster carry)
-Spare magazine holder (if running spare magazine, recommended but not required)
-Basic firearm knowledge/proficiency (firearm handling, loading, unloading)
-Must have fired at least 250rds through firearm
-AN OPEN MIND AND WILLINGNESS TO LEARN!
Be aware, we will do a lot of shooting during this class. More than you probably would in a typical range session while holstering your firearm into your concealment holster. The firearm will get hot due to the faster pace and volume of shooting during strings of fire.
**Payment of $150 per person due at sign up to reserve your slot. Minimum 2 students, if the minimum is not met, the class will be postponed. Maximum of 4 students for this class. Must be fully prepared day of class. Please inquire about requirements or any questions prior to the class with Ray (ray@volusiatopgun.com).
Ray (General Manager) travels to take multiple classes from advanced instructors yearly to continue his education and further his progress. He constantly trains monthly and pushes to his personal limits. He takes the knowledge he gains and acquires and passes it on to help you develop a solid foundation to build from.
Events
Wine Down
Wednesday
Every Wednesday is ladies’ day!
Wine down after work by unloading some rounds at the range and then joining us for a drink at the Double Barrel Grill.
Ladies receive half off range fees and firearm rentals at the range, and a buy one get one free domestic draft beer or house wine at Double Barrel Grill when you show your range receipt to your server. This offer is valid only on day of range visit. Your receipt can also be used for a soda of your choice.
Thank You Thursdays!!
Here at Volusia Top  Gun we appreciate everything that our first responders and military have done for us and our country.
To say thanks, ANY first responder (police, fire, evac) and Military Personal (Active, Retired, Discharged) can come use the range for 1/2 price.
ACTIVE LAW ENFORCEMENT
are half off range fees every day (Law Enforcement Officer as defined in FL Statute 943.10)
Range / Store Hours:
Monday – Thursday: 10 a.m. – 7 p.m.
Friday – Saturday: 10 a.m. – 8 p.m.
Sunday: 11 a.m. – 5 p.m
Phone:
386-363-3534
or
386-872-1047 (TEXTING CAPABLE)

-AN OPEN MIND AND WILLINGNESS TO LEARN!
Be aware, we will do a lot of shooting during this class. More than you probably would in a typical range session while holstering your firearm into your concealment holster. The firearm will get hot due to the faster pace and volume of shooting during strings of fire.
**Payment of $150 per person due at sign up to reserve your slot. Minimum 2 students, if the minimum is not met, the class will be postponed. Maximum of 4 students for this class. Must be fully prepared day of class. Please inquire about requirements or any questions prior to the class with Ray (ray@volusiatopgun.com).
Ray (General Manager) travels to take multiple classes from advanced instructors yearly to continue his education and further his progress. He constantly trains monthly and pushes to his personal limits. He takes the knowledge he gains and acquires and passes it on to help you develop a solid foundation to build from.
Events
Wine Down
Wednesday
Every Wednesday is ladies’ day!
Wine down after work by unloading some rounds at the range and then joining us for a drink at the Double Barrel Grill.
Ladies receive half off range fees and firearm rentals at the range, and a buy one get one free domestic draft beer or house wine at Double Barrel Grill when you show your range receipt to your server. This offer is valid only on day of range visit. Your receipt can also be used for a soda of your choice.
Thank You Thursdays!!
Here at Volusia Top  Gun we appreciate everything that our first responders and military have done for us and our country.
To say thanks, ANY first responder (police, fire, evac) and Military Personal (Active, Retired, Discharged) can come use the range for 1/2 price.
ACTIVE LAW ENFORCEMENT
are half off range fees every day (Law Enforcement Officer as defined in FL Statute 943.10)
